page.title: 05Trusley Church - Building
page.content: First church was built in{1150,}the present church was built in{1713}by the{Coke family.}Material - brick with stone facing.(Vestry was built later) The South door way may have come from a house which is decorated with bulls - pagan fertility symbols.Boxed pews -Large three decker{pulpit.}There are no choir stalls - Pipe organ - Alabaster font.There are funeral hatchments with decorated walls,also there are four{stained glass windows which represent-- {Birth,Crucifixion,Resurrection and {Ascension of Christ.}All in memory of the{Coke family. Royal Coat of Arms - motto{"SEMPER EADEM"-"Always the same" This is not the usual motto. The Coat of Arms of the Coke famliy is on the ceiling and three stone{plaques remain from{Elizabethan Times. {Silver chalice & paten made 1633.
